2020-09-will-mother.title: Mother’s will in Adam’s favor
2020-09-will-mother.summary: Mother died; will in favor of Adam.
2020-09-will-mother.details: In September 2020 Adam’s mother passed away, leaving a will in his favor. In the following months he did not use the inherited property. Relatives raised no claims while the father was alive.

2021-04-father-dx-will.title: Father’s diagnosis; will in Adam’s favor
2021-04-father-dx-will.summary: Father diagnosed with cancer; will already made.
2021-04-father-dx-will.details: In April 2021 Adam’s father was diagnosed with terminal cancer. By that time he had already made a will in Adam’s favor.

2021-07-father-death-claims.title: Father’s death; filing of international claims
2021-07-father-death-claims.summary: Relatives filed claims; lengthy applications (~100 pages).
2021-07-father-death-claims.details: In July 2021 Adam’s father died. Almost simultaneously, relatives filed international lawsuits contesting the parents’ wills. The claims spanned about 100 pages and aimed to maximize the duration of blocking Adam’s rights and assets. Some claims were filed while the father was still alive but already incapacitated. On legal advice Adam suspended transactions on his personal accounts.

2021-07-asset-freeze.title: Full asset freeze and restrictions
2021-07-asset-freeze.summary: Asset and travel restrictions in force.
2021-07-asset-freeze.details: Comprehensive measures were imposed to freeze assets and restrict movements. The freeze covers accounts and real estate and remains in effect to this day.

2021-09-apartment-dispute.title: Dispute over living in Adam’s apartment
2021-09-apartment-dispute.summary: Sister refused temporary stay; dispute over eviction.
2021-09-apartment-dispute.details: During a trip to the US for CAR-T diagnostics Adam contacted his sister, who was living in his apartment, asking to stay temporarily. She refused, citing ‘discomfort’. Adam told her he did not wish her to continue living there for free and asked her to move out. She refused, claiming that under the asset freeze Adam had no right to evict her.

2021-11-prelim-scheduled.title: Preliminary hearing scheduled
2021-11-prelim-scheduled.details: The court issued an order scheduling a preliminary hearing in the inheritance case for July 2024.

2022-03-hearing-travel.title: Hearing on right to travel for treatment
2022-03-hearing-travel.summary: Consideration of permission to travel to US; relatives objected.
2022-03-hearing-travel.details: The court considered granting Adam permission to travel to the US for CAR-T therapy. Relatives objected. A forensic medical examination was conducted.

2022-03-permission-travel.title: Permission to travel for treatment
2022-03-permission-travel.summary: Court allowed travel to US for therapy.
2022-03-permission-travel.details: The court granted Adam’s petition and allowed him to travel to the US for therapy.

2022-05-visit-med-exam.title: Relatives’ visit; demand for medical exam
2022-05-visit-med-exam.summary: Police intervened; restrictions imposed on relatives.
2022-05-visit-med-exam.details: Relatives came to Adam’s house demanding to take him for a medical exam, citing a possible court order for guardianship. Adam refused, and medical staff denied them access. Police intervened in the conflict. The court ruled such demands were inadmissible without Adam’s consent, sentenced the relatives to one month in custody and imposed a six-month ban on entering the country for attempting to forcibly remove him from his home to an unknown destination.

2024-06-eviction-start.title: Eviction procedure against sister initiated
2024-06-eviction-start.summary: Adam began process of evicting sister.
2024-06-eviction-start.details: In late June 2024 Adam initiated eviction proceedings against his sister after learning she was the main initiator of the lawsuit. Previously (in 2021-09) she had refused him temporary residence. Later she claimed in court the eviction was unlawful, but the court found no violations.

2024-07-docs-fee.title: Submission of documents; payment of fee
2024-07-docs-fee.summary: Documents submitted before hearing; $5,350 fee paid.
2024-07-docs-fee.details: Before the preliminary hearing Adam submitted financial account statements and medical documents, and paid a court fee of $5,350.

2024-07-prelim-hearing.title: Preliminary hearing; two possible outcomes
2024-07-prelim-hearing.details: The court outlined two scenarios: (1) upholding the wills and awarding inheritance to Adam; (2) division of inheritance among all children if parental coercion was proven. Relatives refused settlement.

2024-07-motion-freeze-relatives.title: Motion to freeze relatives’ accounts
2024-07-motion-freeze-relatives.summary: Freeze and review of financial transactions requested.
2024-07-motion-freeze-relatives.details: At the same hearing Adam filed a motion to freeze relatives’ accounts and review their financial transactions.

2024-08-relatives-freeze.title: Relatives’ accounts frozen
2024-08-relatives-freeze.details: The court granted Adam’s motion to freeze relatives’ accounts for financial audit.

2025-07-unfreeze-motion.title: Motion to unfreeze assets
2025-07-unfreeze-motion.details: Due to his health condition and newly diagnosed leukemia Adam filed a motion to fully or partially unfreeze his assets, even though his lawyer opposed it, arguing it would only delay proceedings. But Adam had no choice: he urgently needed funds because of the new leukemia form and the uncertain treatment scenario.

2026-11-hearing-scheduled.title: Hearing on motion scheduled
2026-11-hearing-scheduled.details: In August 2025 the court accepted Adam’s motion for review and scheduled a hearing for November 2026.
